lines.text: [first lines]

[narrating]
The world is full o' complainers. An' the fact is, nothin' comes with a guarantee. Now I don't care if you're the pope of Rome, President of the United States or Man of the Year; somethin' can all go wrong. Now go on ahead, y'know, complain, tell your problems to your neighbor, ask for help, 'n watch him fly. Now, in Russia, they got it mapped out so that everyone pulls for everyone else... that's the theory, anyway. But what I know about is Texas, an' down here... you're on your own.
If you point a gun at someone, you'd better make sure you shoot him, and if you shoot him you'd better make sure he's dead, because if he isn't then he's gonna get up and try to kill you.
[last lines]

[after shooting Visser]
I'm not afraid o' you, Marty.

[laughing hysterically]
Well, ma'am, if I see him, I'll sure give him the message.
"Creighton," I says. "I hope your wife really loves you, because for the next five weeks, you can't even wipe your own god damn ass."
[laughs]
That's the test, ain't it? Test of true love.
I got a job for you.
Uh, well, if the pay's right, and it's legal, I'll do it.
It's not strictly legal.

[Thinks for a second]
Well, if the pay's right, I'll do it.
He was alive when I buried him.

[to Ray, out in back of the bar]
You think I'm funny, I'm an asshole? No no no... what's funny is HER... what's funny is, I had you two followed, because if it's not you she's sleeping with, it's someone else... what's funny is, when she gives you that LOOK, and says, 'I don't know what you're talkin' about, Ray, I ain't done nothin' funny'... but the funniest thing to ME is... you think SHE came back HERE for YOU... THAT'S what's FUCKIN' FUNNY!
Gimme a call whenever you wanna cut off my head. I can always crawl around without it.
I ain't done nothing funny.
[Visser has just given Marty some bad news]
You know... in Greece, they would cut off the head of the messenger that brought the bad news.
Now that don't make much sense.
No. It made them feel better.

Well first off, Julian, I don't know what the story is in Greece but in this state we got very definite laws about that. Second place I ain't a messenger, I'm a private investigator. And third place - and most important - it ain't such bad news. I mean you thought he was a colored.
[he laughs]
You're always assumin' the worst.
Marty. Thought you were dead. You goin' home?
No. I'm staying right here in hell.
Kind of a bleak point of view there, isn't it, Marty?
Meurice... I don't want the asshole near my money. And I don't want him in the bar.

[pause]
We get a lotta assholes in here, Marty.

[after Visser agrees to kill Abby and Ray for $10,000]
I'll take care of the money, you just make sure those bodies aren't found...
[starts to turn away, then turns back]
... there's a big incinerator in back of my place.

[after Marty walks away]
Jeeee-sus, you are disgustin'.
[Marty gives Visser his money]
Count it, and go.
Naw, I trust you.
[Visser shoots Marty]

[to Marty]
Who looks stupid now?
And remember, gentlemen, we're always here, two to two, A.M. to P.M., three hundred and sixty-four days and Christmas, God willing and the creek don't rise.
Howdy stranger.
Meurice. Sorry I didn't show last night.

Wasn't too busy. You missed a good one, though. This white guy walks in about one o'clock, asks if we have a discount for alcoholics... I tell him to get lost, but Marty's sitting here listening and I can tell he's thinking that maybe it ain't such a bad idea.
He took me to a psychiatrist one time, to calm me down... the psychiatrist said I was the healthiest person he'd ever talked to, so Marty fired him.
I don't think you can fire a psychiatrist, 'zactly.
Well I never saw him again, I can tell you that.
I said, "Marty, how come you're anal, and *I* gotta go to the psychiatrist?"
What'd he say?
Nothing. He's like you, he doesn't say much.
Thanks.
Except when he doesn't say things, they're usually nasty. When you don't, they're usually nice.
[grabbing Abby from behind after breaking into Ray's house]
Lover boy really oughta lock his door. Lotta nuts out there.

[to Ray]
Look. Personally I don't give a shit. I know Marty's a hard-on but you gotta do something. I don't know; give the money back, say you're sorry, or get the fuck out of here, or something... It's very humiliating, preaching about this shit... I'm not laughing at this, Ray Bob, so you know it's no fucking joke.
He gave me a little pearl-handled .38 for our first anniversary.
Uh-huh.
Figured I'd better leave before I used it on him. I don't know how you can stand him.
Well, I'm only an employee, I ain't married to him.

[looking at a doctored photo of Ray and Abby]
Dead?
So it would seem.
Ray?
You're bad.
What?
I said you're bad.

[long pause, then smiles]
You're bad too.
We're both bad.
Lover-boy oughta lock his door. I love you... That's a stupid thing to say, right?
I... I love you too.

[smiling]
No. You're just saying that because you're scared. You left your weapon behind... He'll kill you too.
JEEEE-zus, I've got a hangover...
[picks up a bottle of liquor]
... you wanta drink?

[referring to Marty]
Fact is... he's ANAL, Ray!
Hmmmmm?

[pointing to her forehead]
In HERE... Abby, in HERE... I'm anal.
Well, I'll be damned.
I couldn't believe it myself.
Let's do it outside, in nature.

[about a photo of Ray and Abby]
I know a place you can get that framed.
What did you take these for?
What do you mean? Just doin' my job.
You called me, I knew they were there, so what do I need these for?
Well, I don't know... Call it a fringe benefit.
How long did you watch her?
Most of the night... They'd just rest a few minutes and then get started again. Quite something.
